history.text: hi, do you like animated movies?
Hi, Yes I do. Zootopia happens to be one of them.
How about you?
yes, I love everything that has to do with disney, zootopia is my favorite
Did you imagine Jason Bateman doing a character like these?

Not at all! I thought he only did live-movies and not animated ones. 
Did you know that Ginnifer Goodwin played the character of Officer Judy Hopps? I didn't know about it until today. I thought Officer Hopps was played by someone else. It's also interesting that Idris Elba played Chief Bogo in this movie.
Like I did not know this, but then you understand why these characters were so well developed, thanks to these great actors
Which was your favorite scene?

Me neither! I had no idea A-listers played for Zootopia! My favorite scene from the movie was when they found out that Dawn Bellwether, the assistant mayor, was the culprit in all of the missing animals and when Officer Hopps and Nick were able to catch her using Hopps' recording pen.
What about you? What's your favorite scene from the movie?
my favorite scene is when Mr. Big appears with his bodyguards ... it's the funniest thing in the whole movie
That's interesting! Did you think that Nick was culprit from the beginning of the movie?
the truth is that at the beginning it looked something malicious, but not really, if he suspected that it would be the one that one least would imagine
Did you watch this movie because of its critical ratings or why?
I didn't suspect him at all actually. I thought it was the mayor who was involved with the missing animals. No, I watched the movie right as it came out of the theaters
Did not the animals scare you when they were wild?
Not at all. I thought it was pretty cool! What about you?
if it gave me some fear, because I saw it with my son and he also got a little scared
What did you feel about the wolves or the night howlers? I thought they were pretty cute as wolves.
if that part was very cool ,
What did you think of the "great idea" of the mayor when hiding everything ???

I thought it was pretty neat, but a little bit cliche since since Sheeps are considered to be intelligent animals. Regardless, I thought the usage of the symbolism between the animals gave life to the movie
What do you think about the decision of Judy's resignation? Was not something very hurried?
I thought her decision to resign was the right decision at the time although not the best idea. Had she not resigned, I think even worse things would have happened. What about you?
Well yeah, you're right there...when Judy discovered everything and was reunited with Nick, it was something very touching, what did you think?
I thought it was sweet. I didn't think they'd up together. What about you?
the truth if I had the hope
when you shot nick you thought it would happen?
Not at all. Since Zootopia is a children's movie, I didn't think there'd be romance at all.
I accept that it scares me a little, I do not imagine seeing Nick act in that way
Same. He's a pretty nice fox, but it had to happen otherwise they wouldn't capture the assistant mayor
that's true, Nick from the beginning proved to be more intelligent than everyone, for me he was the most important character in the whole movie
Thanks for talking to me about! I enjoyed the movie a lot more now since you've explained many different ideas.

uid2response.feedback: thanks guys , love it this hit
